0.title: How Trump’s Attacks on the Fed Chair Have Intensified
0.summary: President Trump has targeted Jerome H. Powell on more than 70 separate occasions, more than half of them since April. His statements fall into four broad categories.

1.title: Trump Spars With Powell Over Fed’s Costly Renovations in Rare Visit
1.summary: The administration has repeatedly criticized Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the central bank, for his handling of the economy and the cost of work on the institution’s headquarters.

2.title: ‘Unprecedented’ Investment Fund Seals Deal for Japan and Expands Trump’s Influence
2.summary: President Trump will get to decide where to invest Japanese money and the United States will keep 90 percent of the profits, the White House said.

3.title: Trump’s Tariffs Are the Highest in a Century. But After His Threats, They Seem Like a Relief.
3.summary: The president imposed tariffs on Japan, one of America’s closest allies, that would have been alarming just months ago. And markets went up.

4.title: In New Deal, Trump Keeps Tariffs While Indonesia Drops Trade Barriers
4.summary: The administration provided some insight into the terms that were agreed upon between Indonesia and the United States, hinting at how other vague and hastily negotiated deals may turn out.

5.title: White House Keeps Pressure on Powell Over Rate Cuts and Renovations
5.summary: President Trump and his top aides have criticized Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, for his management of both the economy and a $2.5 billion revamp of the central bank’s headquarters.

6.title: Philippines’ Leader Meets With Trump to Clinch Trade Deal
6.summary: President Trump announced that he had secured a deal with the country that will leave a 19 percent tariff in place, though no details were immediately available.

7.title: As Trump Courts a More Assertive Beijing, China Hawks Are Losing Out
7.summary: The Trump administration has dialed back aggressive measures against China and reversed its position on technology controls as the president angles for a Chinese trip later this year.

8.title: Indonesia Confirms U.S. Trade Agreement, but Details Remain Scarce
8.summary: President Trump said the agreement would partly walk back some of the steep tariffs he threatened on the country last week. Indonesia’s president called Mr. Trump a “tough negotiator.”

9.title: Rising Inflation Underscores Risks in Trump’s New Tariff Threats
9.summary: New data showing price increases last month could foreshadow even higher costs if the president imposes steep tariffs on Aug. 1.

10.title: Another Casualty in the Tariff Wars: The Always-in-Season Tomato
10.summary: The Trump administration is adding a 17 percent tariff to a year-round grocery store staple, while funneling more business to domestic tomato growers, largely in Florida.

11.title: The Economy Has Been Resilient. The New Round of Tariffs May Hit Harder.
11.summary: The economy’s resilience so far to President Trump’s global trade war risks emboldening him and unleashing the sort of economic devastation that economists have long feared.

12.title: He Helped Big Companies Dodge Taxes. Now He’s Writing the Rules.
12.summary: Ken Kies, a longtime tax lobbyist who worked for some of the world’s largest businesses, is now running the Treasury Department’s office that will administer Trump’s tax law.

13.title: It’s No Bluff: The Tariff Rate Is Soaring Under Trump
13.summary: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.

14.title: Under Attack by Trump’s Tariffs, Asian Countries Seek Out Better Friends
14.summary: Most nations are still negotiating in hopes of avoiding punitive import taxes. At the same time, they’re looking for trading partners as a way around the United States.

15.title: Tariffs or Deals? Trump Seems Content With Punishing Levies.
15.summary: The president’s supporters portray him as a top dealmaker. But, at least for now, far more trading partners have gotten stiff tariffs than trade deals.

16.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
16.summary: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will do next.

17.title: Trump Fuels Fear, Rage and Hope in California’s Central Valley
17.summary: The fertile valley feeds the world. President Trump has thrown farmers and farmworkers there into turmoil, but recently offered them a glimmer of hope.

18.title: Trump Tariffs Aim to Settle Scores With Countries, No Matter Their Size
18.summary: The president’s tariff announcements suggest he has not backed away from his initial strategy, where even smaller trading partners will face tariffs.

19.title: Trump Treats Tariffs More as a Form of Power Than as a Trade Tool
19.summary: Instead of viewing tariffs as part of a broader trade policy, President Trump sees them as a valuable weapon he can wield on the world stage.

20.title: With Taxes and Tariffs in Place, Trump Takes Reins of U.S. Economy
20.summary: President Trump has achieved much of his agenda, leaving the fate of the economy squarely in his hands.

21.title: What Is a Trade Deal? Trump Takes an Expansive View.
21.summary: The president is deploying the word “deal” liberally, using the term to describe all kinds of trade arrangements, some very limited or one-sided.

22.title: Trump’s New Trade Threats Set Off Global Scramble to Avoid Tariffs
22.summary: Many countries thought they were negotiating in good faith. The White House renewed its “reciprocal” tariff plan anyway, giving countries until Aug. 1 to make offers.

23.title: The Mexican Businessman Grateful for Trump’s Tariffs
23.summary: A small company in northern Mexico had faced steep competition from China in making straps, plugs, fasteners, grommets, zip ties and clamps. Now, U.S. tariffs have driven a spike in his business.

24.title: E.U., Mexico, Brazil: Who Has Trump Targeted With New Tariffs?
24.summary: President Trump has told more than two dozen countries that they will face tariffs of at least 20 percent on Aug. 1 if they don’t reach agreements by then.

25.title: Trump Revives Trade War, Threatening Steep Aug. 1 Tariffs on Allies
25.summary: President Trump said Japan and South Korea would face tariffs of 25 percent unless they reached an agreement with the United States. Other countries received notice of higher levies.

26.title: Trump Keeps Foreign Countries on Edge as Tariff Deadline Nears
26.summary: The president is again threatening higher tariff rates on a dozen foreign nations, as a deadline elapses this week for making trade deals.

27.title: Bessent Says He Expects Trade Deals by This Week’s Deadline
27.summary: But the Treasury secretary also said that some countries working toward agreements with the United States could have until Aug. 1.

28.title: How Health Care Remade the U.S. Economy
28.summary: Medicine is now the nation’s largest employer, but its growth may be slowing.

29.title: As a Nation’s Economy Slows, Some Say It’s No Time for a Free Lunch
29.summary: Indonesia’s president promised free meals for every student in the country. But unemployment is rising, and some analysts say he’s making matters worse.

0.title: Who Pays for U.S. Tariffs, and Where Does the Money Go?
0.summary: President Trump is seeking to raise federal revenue by imposing levies on goods from foreign nations. Here’s how the process works.

1.title: See Trump’s New Tariffs on Every Country
1.summary: The president is set to raise taxes on imports arriving from many countries, including Canada and Mexico. That’s on top of the tariffs that the White House has already announced on specific products, including foreign cars.

2.title: How Trump’s Attacks on the Fed Chair Have Intensified

0.title: Stock Market Posts Worst Week in Months on Renewed Economic Fears
0.summary: Data showing cracks in the U.S. labor market and President Trump’s newest barrage of tariffs shook investors around the world, weighing on stocks, the dollar and more.

1.title: Fed Governor Steps Down Early, Giving Trump Opportunity to Shape Central Bank
1.summary: The resignation comes as President Trump has openly pressured the central bank to lower interest rates and called for Jerome H. Powell, the chair, to step down.

2.title: Trump, Claiming Weak Jobs Numbers Were ‘Rigged,’ Moves to Fire Labor Official
2.summary: Economists said ousting the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics could undermine confidence in government economic data.

3.title: Recent global trade deals with the U.S. were secured with murky investments.
3.summary: were secured with huge, often vaguely defined investment pledges from partners like Japan.

4.title: How Tariffs Raise Costs for Farmers, Making Food More Expensive
4.summary: The latest round of tariffs is likely to make agricultural production even more expensive and, potentially, limit access to goods not produced in the United States.

5.title: Overturning the Global Trade System, Trump Puts His Ideas to the Test
5.summary: President Trump has long wanted to rework world trade. The tariffs set to go into effect next week will carry out that plan.

6.title: Federal Government Shed 12,000 Jobs in July
6.summary: The U.S. government has lost 84,000 jobs since January as the Trump administration aggressively reduces the work force.

7.title: Big Downward Jobs Revisions Could Be a Warning Sign for the Economy
7.summary: Employers added far fewer jobs in May and June than previously reported. Such downgrades have historically meant trouble for the labor market.

8.title: India Reels From the Shock of Trump’s Onslaught
8.summary: Russian oil poses just one problem. Business groups are flummoxed by the variety and vagueness of the American president’s complaints.

9.title: Weak Jobs Report Raises Chances of a September Interest Rate Cut
9.summary: The Federal Reserve held rates steady in July but two governors dissented, saying they had concerns about labor market fragility.

0.title: Trade Fueled Inequality. Can Trump’s Tariffs Reduce It?
0.summary: The president has pitched his trade policies at workers who feel left behind by globalization. But that doesn’t mean trade barriers will revive factories and close income gaps.

11.title: Stock Market Posts Worst Week in Months on Renewed Economic Fears
11.summary: Data showing cracks in the U.S. labor market and President Trump’s newest barrage of tariffs shook investors around the world, weighing on stocks, the dollar and more.

12.title: Switzerland Is Stunned by 39% U.S. Tariff, Among the Highest in the World
12.summary: Swiss officials plan to negotiate urgently for a lower rate, before the punishing levy takes effect next week.

13.title: Harm or Help? Why Companies Are Battling Tariffs Meant to Benefit Them.
13.summary: Economists say the way the Trump administration is imposing tariffs is backfiring for some of the businesses they are meant to help.

14.title: Cambodia Agrees to a Reduced Tariff and Breathes a Sigh of Relief
14.summary: Initially 49%, it was lowered to 19%, easing worries of a damaging hit to the country’s garment and footwear production industries.

15.title: Here is the latest.
15.summary: This was featured in live coverage.

16.title: Countries Promise Trump to Buy U.S. Gas, and Leave the Details for Later
16.summary: U.S. trading partners are committing to buy more gas than they need or than the U.S. can produce, at least in the short term.

17.title: South Korea Reaches Trade Deal With Trump
17.summary: The agreement comes after other American allies, like Japan, clinched their own deals, partly to moderate President Trump’s tariff threats.

18.title: Trump Targets Copper With Tariffs, Though Not as Aggressively as Expected
18.summary: The president stopped short of putting a 50 percent tariff on refined copper, as he had threatened earlier this year. The market reaction was swift anyway and prices tumbled.

19.title: See How Often Fed Governors Have Broken Ranks
19.summary: Two top Fed officials voted against the central bank’s decision to leave rates unchanged, the first dual dissent in more than 30 years.
